website_summaries.verdict: A compact but mighty gas tiller that will make quick work of small to moderate garden and yard cultivating jobs.
pros: A fairly compact machine that offers a 33cc 2-cycle engine capable of breaking up tough soil
Simple to maneuver in and out of rows and around plants
Great for small to medium-sized gardens
cons: A few owners had difficulties starting it
Assembly is somewhat challenging, and the instructions lack clear details

customer_reviews.title: Powerful little Package
customer_reviews.text: We bought this tiller because it looks very well balanced and easy enough for my wife and I to run in our garden. What we were surprised at was how much power this thing had to break up new soil. We read that you can remove the outer tines and make this in to a smaller cultivator, not a bad option if we ever decide to go that route.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Jerry Dickson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Machine
customer_reviews.text: Great machine, easy to start and use, only problem is the length of time to assemble. Took me about two hours, and I am very mechanically inclined. Have to fight to align holes.
customer_reviews.author: JEFFREY FARRISH

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: I ran a couple strips the first day. Second day check the oil and the gas. Started it up when I tried to start tillering it started shaking then shot it out the side.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Meeks

customer_reviews.title: Some assembly required
customer_reviews.text: was able to assemble in about an hour. tiller comes with a quart of oil and instructions are explicit about putting oil in before stating but it doesn't say how much to put in just don't over or under fill, guess what... seems to need half quart so had oil on grange floor. started easily and tilled pre-worked soil well sure how well it will work on sod but front tine tillers really aren't designed to break established sod and I have a guy with a tractor w/pto tiller for that. at this point in time seems like a good investment after I have used it for a couple of weeks I will update this review
customer_reviews.author: jm

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as I could not find one in my area. Item arrived timely and undamaged. Used to break up hard clay soil with spots of dead sod and till in new soil and additives to replant large section of lawn. This tiller worked great, no problems breaking up new ground but I started at first drag spike height and eventually went full depth. Made 20-30 passes during the day, 1/2 tank of gas and no problems. Pulled up 1-3 inches diameter stones, twigs and debris without bogging down or any issues.
customer_reviews.author: C50

customer_reviews.title: Great product. As advertised.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this cultivator to do work around our farm. It’s useful in the garden, flower beds and other landscaping areas we have. We chose this unit over an electric tiller because we didn’t want to worry about a cord with where our locations of our gardens are. Its super light weight and easy to control. Works great for me. Wife loves it. Really happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Schauf

customer_reviews.title: This cultivator is great!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a house in the fall that had an overgrown garden I wanted to bring back to life. I bought the TAZZ cultivator in hopes to get my pre existing raised gardens back to life. It went far beyond my expectations and then some. This is a very powerful piece of equipment for the money. I would highly recommend this to anyone who needs to work in a garden big or small.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Great for women!!!
customer_reviews.text: It’s easy to start and light enough for me to handle. I’m 57 and I do not have a lot of strength in my arms but this tiller is by far the best. I do not have to wait for my husband to help me anymore, Yea! It doesn’t shake hard at all. It does it job 100% if your husband put on the blades correctly the first time lol.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie L. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tiller
customer_reviews.text: This thing tore up North Carolina clay soil without any trouble and it started on the first pull. Never hear of the brand until I saw it listed online as one of the top rated units without any negatives. The only issue that cropped up during assembly was that some of the bolt and nut sizes didn't match the instructions, which was inconsequential. It was very easy to control and I had no problem lifting it into a box garden for tilling. I would definitely recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: tazz mini cultavator.
customer_reviews.text: this tiller is extremly hard to start, makes it worthless. wish I had never purchased. needs to be back where it came from.
customer_reviews.author: James Bales

customer_reviews.title: Not a four stroke but a very nice product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the TAZZ 33cc garden tiller at first I was told it was a 4 stroke motor but being a mechanic it is definitely a 2 stroke mix the oil with the gas. So that kind of bummed me out but overall it is well build has the same motor my ice auger has so it should hold up good. Wife loves the size and how easy it is to change the blades from 12 to 6 inches
customer_reviews.author: Johndeere4440

customer_reviews.title: I’m no expert...
customer_reviews.text: I needed this to ready small patches around the property for raised beds, etc. It’s slow going, but I was able to rip through 6” of sod and some hard packed dirt from vehicles, it’s definitely mini and bounces about a bit, but as a female it’s exactly my size and what I needed to get the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Kim Brooks-Ondeck

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I have use this for about 20 hours now. It has plenty of power, and does a great job. Well worth the money. It takes about 4 pulls to start but always runs great. I bought this to replace a STIHL that was about 12 years old. It finally just wore out... i hope this one lasts as long....
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine. No problems.
customer_reviews.text: My husband said there was very little to assembly. Easy. He uses it to weed between the garden rows. It goes quickly and has good power. Zips right along. He prefers using it without the piece in the back that sticks down to guide it. That way it doesn't bog down in one place.
customer_reviews.author: GAIL

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: Best money spent ever! I used this to turn up a plot for a 100’ X 75’ garden. The grass area had never been plowed before, the dirt was really hard and even had clay areas too. It took 5 days working about 3 hours a day to fully plow up 10” deep with ease. Can’t wait to use it next year.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Micheau

customer_reviews.title: Great for small jobs, bad with clay
customer_reviews.text: This little cultivator is great for my raised garden beds. I would not recommend it for working soils that are mostly clay; the clutch slips and it stops spinning when it gets bogged down. I got it to use on compost and for stirring soil amendments into my raised beds.
customer_reviews.author: Naked Dog

customer_reviews.title: 100% Satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Give me a couple of gallons of gas and I'll dig to China with this thing. Powerful. Easy to manage. Creates a fine granular soil that's perfect for final grading or adding soil amendments. The jeans I was wearing had a hole in the knee and this thing was kicking dirt up high enough that the dirt was going down my pant leg.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handles are not adjustable
customer_reviews.text: Handles need to be adjustable for height. I am 5'2" and I really have to have a very uncomfortable reach to help the machine run smoothly. They are too high - need to be able to lower. Easy to put together and start otherwise. Could be easier to handle for someone taller.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi B.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Little Tiller!
customer_reviews.text: We were very surprised how powerful this is. It also starts at first pull, and it seems very reliable. We have used it to make a new garden area and it has destroyed thick weed roots! I recommend this for light to medium garden work.
customer_reviews.author: Hall

customer_reviews.title: Not for a large garden.
customer_reviews.text: Very little power. Have to force it down into the ground to make even the slightest difference. Not for a large garden.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Ryan

customer_reviews.title: It works really well!
customer_reviews.text: It is not super light but I was surprised by the power. I was pleasantly surprised at how well it tilled up our weed infested garden.
customer_reviews.author: john cannon

customer_reviews.title: This Tazz Is Awsome
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this tiller does a awsome job, easy to put together, put gas in it and first pull of the rope it fired right up, i WOULD not have to think of buying this again would do so without a doubt...only negetive I had was took about a month to ship out to me...
customer_reviews.author: Boone

customer_reviews.title: Great for intended use
customer_reviews.text: I have no real complaint on the product, however I would rather have things delivered by donkey cart than UPS. Always late on items like this.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: It just arrived and I immediately unboxed it. Assembled it in 5 minutes (I didn't read the instructions so I had to remove the uprights and re install them correctly) Still assembled in 5 minutes without tools. Mixed the 2 stroke gas and started it rirgt up on the 5th pull of the starter rope. Since it has started and ran just fine on the first pull.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse
customer_reviews.text: After trying to find a rototiller at the big box stores, and not successful at all. Who doesn't need a rototiller in the spring gardening? I was apprehensive buying a large tool like this online, but I couldn't be happier with this product. This machine worked as hard as advertised and that is saying something when my ground is hard clay and rocks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: The Tazz is an excellent tiller that has worked out well the first 45 days of ownership. It is easy to maneuver around the garden and has plenty of power. Love the idea of being able to easily adjust the widths of the tines! It started first pull after assembly. The only negative comment is the unit was more difficult then I expected to put together. Took me close to 2 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Falcetto

customer_reviews.title: it won't start and the instructions are horrible.
customer_reviews.text: it won't start and the instructions are horrible. I called and couldn't get it started, then customer service disconnected (i don't think it was on purpose she was very nice and tried to explain to me how to get it going.) It started once and that was it. It if got stolen from me it was great. But sadly it's still here not working.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Arzoumanian

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Husband put it together and used it right after it got delivered which by the way, it was delivered before the estimated date!
customer_reviews.author: LMDMP

customer_reviews.title: Tazz
customer_reviews.text: The Tazz mini cultivator was slightly damaged when I recieved. The box looked like it had been thrown around. The handle bar was bent and needed straightened. Other than that I'm happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Richard Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Good Tiller
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the area we needed not to bad to put together. Best thing when no one in our area had a tiller for sale.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Description is wrong this item is 2 cycle!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered it becuz it said it was a 4cycle gas only no mixing description is wrong it is a 2 cycle oil gas mix.
customer_reviews.author: brenda

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. The only revision I would make would put the gas tank filler on the opposite end of the tank so when you go to clear the debris it is not leaking fuel.
customer_reviews.author: steven harris

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper on TAZZ website
customer_reviews.text: This is a great machine when it works. My tazz cultivator had multiple issues after the first use. First, the pull lever used to start the cultivator broke. Second, the cultivator adjustable tires broke/jammed and last but not least the cultivator stoped reaching full potential.. Also, it’s is 20 dollars cheaper on the official tazz website
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to use to weed our garden and it works great.After we put the handle bars on the correct way...lol. Works great. Has enough weight to it that is doesn't bounce all over the place and is very easy to use. Saves so much time when it comes to weeding. I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: wvureader

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Works as described in ads. Followed starting instructions and this little unit fired up on the :third of fourth pull of the rope. Best if you always pull backwards.
customer_reviews.author: Phil V.

customer_reviews.title: absolutely love this
customer_reviews.text: so the wife and I put this together on the kitchen floor, the directions were not as clear as they could be but we managed to put it together in a little over an hour. lot of discussion little bit of working. have used the heck out of it and absolutely love it so much. so I bought a second one a little smaller. love it too. need a tiller then this is the one to buy,
customer_reviews.author: james castillo

customer_reviews.title: Rototiller was very easy to use just follow the directions and buy stroke fuel
customer_reviews.text: This little rototiller is mighty, I did 100 by 100 square foot in 1 hour
customer_reviews.author: Pacasso

customer_reviews.title: My TILLER
customer_reviews.text: Love my tiller its very amazing very useful. Now my garden will be very plentiful
customer_reviews.author: Wolfborn

customer_reviews.title: not just for the price but top to bottom best I ever seen in this size
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several different name brand mini tillers and the tazz is in a league of it's own. It comes with a quality larger cc motor that gives it a lot more power and still fits nicely in the same areas in my small tight garden. Everything on it from top to bottom is better built and better quality than any other one I have seen. Just a great product.
customer_reviews.author: david pokojski

customer_reviews.title: Great tiller, start easily
customer_reviews.text: Good little tiller/cultivator for the money, not as good as mantis when it comes to power and dig depth, however unlike mantis is starts every time within a few pulls. I've ran mine on Stihl motomix does great.
customer_reviews.author: Criddlelittle

customer_reviews.title: Good machine
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Not too difficult to assemble. Good quality materials, yet still light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Moreland

customer_reviews.title: Nice little machine
customer_reviews.text: It's a little more tiller than I expected, it works well to cultivate previously tilled soil. It's easy to start and easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Steven O.

customer_reviews.title: Machine does not come with oil in engine. MUST ADD OIL!
customer_reviews.text: Have a small vegetable garden and this is perfect for it. Put together in less than an hour. Gassed it up,put in oil as directed and cranked on second pull. Very happy with tiller.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Benson

customer_reviews.title: quality Item
customer_reviews.text: Great Tiller for my home garden, deep tilling and really mixes up the soil.Easy to use. A+
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Prindle

customer_reviews.title: I call her the dirt demon.
customer_reviews.text: I love this little dirt demon. I am using it to keep the weeds down in my garden, it is small enough and light enough to maneuver between my rows.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little thing
customer_reviews.text: Comparing to a Mantis Tiller that my dad had . All most the same just different name . Quick and easy assembly. Fired right up straight out of the box .
customer_reviews.author: lucinda young

customer_reviews.title: just what I wanted and got it delivered right to my door!
customer_reviews.text: the direct drive. runs good. using it for my garden
customer_reviews.author: Kay B.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible  DON'T BUY
customer_reviews.text: Used it twice worked fine. Now it will not till garden soil. Worthless!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Indiana grandma

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: The recoil broke on this on the 3rd try. Junk, do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Great for small or large gardens.
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly. Get into narrow spaces my big tiller can’t.
customer_reviews.author: steven hames

product_meta.title: TAZZ 35351 33CC Viper Mini Cultivator, Green
product_meta.description: Style:Tazz MC33 Mini CultivatorThe Tazz Cultivator can weed, mix in fertilizer, and mulch or aerate soil. It is designed to work through all types of pre-tilled earth. Its small size and light weight not only make it easy to transport, but it also is very maneuverable around delicate plants. Our US based support staff and 3-Year Limited ensure that you will be highly satisfied with your Tazz Cultivator so you can confidently get out and enjoy your garden.
feature_bullets: BUILT TO WORK: Weed it, Mix it, Aerate it, Mulch it- this 33cc 2-cycle mini cultivator is designed to maximize your ability to tackle soil turning tasks.
SMOOTH AND EFFORTLESS: On-board wheels, overhand controls and a lightweight design make this machine easy to maneuver and simple to use.
EASY TO CONTROL: Zoom around your garden with power and control to weed between rows and around plants. Get it tilled in Tazz Time.
POWERFUL: The Tazz Cultivator 33cc engine is full of power to turn over soil in your garden or flower bed.
SERVICE AND SUPPORT: Our US based support staff and 3-Year Limited ensure that you will be highly satisfied with your Tazz Cultivator so you can confidently get out and enjoy your garden.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars227 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
